characters: INT. DIFED OPEN PLAN OFFICE. DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALCOLM TUCKERS, government director of communications, is arriving early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CIVIL SERVANT hands Malcolm a CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monitoring. All the usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did your team do at the weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright. We won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanker. Malcolm reaches his office. His assistant SAM is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam. Morning. He hands her the CD and she puts it into a CD player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, pop pickers....what Shall we start with today? Wonky Ron....or Simon Foster, on the PM programme for the BBC. Malcolm starts listening to the recording of Simon on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm joined by Simon Foster, the Minister for International development. Thank you for joining us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been in the job now for eighteen months, do you think you're making headway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (v/o on radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Yes I do. You'd expect me to say that I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DIFED OPEN PLAN OFFICE. DAY
dialogues.text: Judy Malloy, the Department's Press Officer, is preparing for her minister's arrival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, are you co-ordinating that millenium goals press release?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well co-ordinate it better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the Minister? Bloody nail - has anyone got a nail file? 4   INT. DFID OPEN PLAN OFFICE. DAY. SIMON is arriving with JUDY. Simon carrying his red dispatch box. Simon's worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we heard anything from Malcolm about last night's interview?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps he didn't hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a degree of genuine hope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might be dead. He might have had that massive stroke we've all been waiting for. It's in the post. 5   INT. MALCOLM'S OFFICE. DAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...preventable sickness in many of the poorest countries round the world....and Of course the big one is diarrhoea, which is a major, major issue....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diarrhoea? I mean, this is the minister for International Development. He should be talking about food parcels, not fucking arse-spraying mayhem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so if we can tackle the easy things, like diarrhoea, then we can.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, say it again. Very good. What is this, The Shitting Forecast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then hopefully that will strike another blow in the war against preventable diseases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mentioned the word `war"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALCOLM is paying extremely close attention now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady Eddie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against preventable diseases, yes....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. All the evidence now points to a US military intervention in the Middle East. Is that you view?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well....personally, I think that war is unforseeable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unforseeable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO YOU DO NOT THINK THAT! Sam! I'm going to have to go over to International Development, and pull Simon Foster's fucking hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALCOLM emerges into the street. On the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did not say "unforseeable'. You may have heard him say it, but he did not say that, and that is a fact. 7   INT. DFI OPEN PLAN OFFICE. DAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll want you to row back from the `unforeseeable' thing on Question Time tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Question Time, you know the funny question they always ask at the end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should prep that now. I'd like to shine on the funny question, cos I'm a funny guy. With a light touch. SIMON deposits his briafcase. Judy finds some clippings, returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's this guy, he's a property tycoon. He's bought a South Sea Island. It might be something like that, you know. "If you had to spend the rest of your life on a desert island, who would it be with?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Well, I can't say my wife, because I haven't got one, and I can't say my girlfriend, because I haven't got one of those either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't say Mandela, that's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Boring. And a bloke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Keira Knightley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pervert. Sex. Minister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and Suzy walking to work together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you take the washing out of the machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I didn't take the washing out of the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to go really stale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not fine. By the time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is fine. I'll wear stale pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go out with some who wears stale pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there we go. I could go commando, but I don't think that's acceptable in government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Disgusted) Please. So: got everything you need for your first day in International Development?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Yes. It's all here. My massive intellect. And an apple for Simon Foster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon Fluster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that, I'm rebranding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he was crap on the radio last night. He sounded like a chicken with a wasp up its arse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm going to sort that out. After a week I'll have him sounding like a chicken without a wasp up its arse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good day, good luck honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good day at the Foreign Office. Try not to annoy Russia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a call later. Keep your phone on. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh and be careful - cars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk off in separate directions.

dialogues.speaker: MORNING/INT. MICHAEL'S FO OFFICE
dialogues.text: Toby is walking towards DFID. As he nears the building he finds himself next to Malcolm, who is heading in too. Toby is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to keep ringing me up every two minutes, because you're starting to remind me of my mum. And that could lead to all sorts of erectile dysfunction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy is still in the FO office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just checking whether you put last night's lasagne in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the FO office, MICHAEL arrives. He has a small suitcase and a paper bag. He holds this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing) Croissants!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with Malcolm, Toby close by. Malc's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're fine to go ahead and print that. It's lies, you'd be lying, but go ahead. He did not say unforeseeable. No he did not. Oh, just before you go -- when I tell your wife about you and Angela Heaney at the Blackpool conference...would email be better? Or a phone call? Or, hey I know, I'll write it on a cake, "Your hack husband betrayed you on the 4th of October, and congratulations on the new baby" in those little silver balls. (BEAT) Yeah, maybe best to spike it? Okay. Fuckity-bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby is now next to Malcolm in the building (or better still, in a lift). Malcolm becomes aware of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine, it's in the fridge. I put some clingfilm over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the FO office, Michael switches on some classical music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you put clingfilm on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep it fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm starts dialling on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the fridge, that'll keep it fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it still might dry out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah, Malcolm Tucker. Can I speak to James Lewis at the PM Programme please?

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: Michael hands Suzie a croissant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowing Toby is on the other end of the line)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still slightly warm. That's how I like my women as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clingfilm is carcinogenic, Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it isn't. That's a myth. Clingfilm is perfectly safe. Malcolm now eyeing Toby with suspicion/contempt -- who is this dick? Toby tries to smile, lowers his voice, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll hold,. what's he waiting for?     A sex-change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't sell clingfilm if it gave you cancer. Clingfilm doesn't give you cancer. And Lasagne doesn't give you syphillis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James! Right --Simon Foster? Yeah, very funny, the Diarrhoea of a Nobody. Listen, we get an easy ride on Tom tomorrow, OK? (getting annoyed) No, YOU relax. Tell you what, I'll come over a lock you in a flotation tank and pump it full of sewage until you drown. GET ME FUCKING BRIAN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and Judy are still prepping the funny question. ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris Hilton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily Allen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Olson twins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy gets a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Right. I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rings off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing something's up) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm's coming to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He's still alive. When's he due?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm walks in with Toby sheepishly behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. And don't say you weren't prepared because I rang ahead. (To JUDY) Give us a minute, will you love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy gets up as Malcolm turns back to SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the words of the late, great Nat King Fucking Cole, `Unforeseeable, that's what you are..'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDY has spotted TOBY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're...whatever your name is, Dan, the new advisor? Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Just most of you lot tend to be called Dan, or Danny, so it's always worth a punt. OK, hello. As you know, I'm Judy Molloy, Civil Service Director of Communications for International Development.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a normal morning, or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy's not got time for questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I've got a meeting in (looks at watch) two minutes. And the minister was rubbish in last night's interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubbish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a technical term. It means he went on the radio and everyone could hear that he was rubbish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone goes into Simon's office. As door opens we hear heated conversation between Simon and Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sounded like a panicky chimp trapped in a washing machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back inside Simon's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Malcolm, he asked me for a personal opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh why didn't you say? I mean, he asked you. Fuck. Of course, that explains it. Yeah. Say, if he'd asked you to fucking black up, or give him your PIN number, or shot yourself, would you have done that as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have blacked up. It was the radio and no-one would have known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But war is -- basically unforeseeable isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not our line, alright? Walk the fucking line. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got Karen Clark over from Washington, okay? We've got the US National Security Advisor's main guy coming. Yeah? We've got enough Pentagon goons here for a fucking coup d'etat. This is not the time to send out a signal like this in some personal fucking sodcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDY and TOBY come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minister, this is Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the time love. Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDY smiles at MALCOLM, and doesn't fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Toby. Glad you could join us. Bit of an odd morning, but 'Welcome to the madhouse!'I apologise for Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't apologise for me. You should apologise for yourself. (to Judy) Did I not just tell you to fuck off and yet you're still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Toby) Hey, foetus boy. Lesson One: If I tell you to fuck off what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll go far.Now fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby fucks off. We can see him outside, wandering around, not knowing what to do with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were thinking, weren't we Judy, that I could row back on Question Time tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, You're not going on Question Time tonight. You've been disinvited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? We've been prepping Question Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they ask fucking questions on Question Time. And you're no good at questions. If it was Fumbling, Off- Message Shit Fucking Answer Time, you'd be our main guy. But it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, why wasn't I told about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I tell you about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's a scheduled media appearance by this department's Secretary Of State and it therefore falls within my purview...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your purview? Where do you think you are sweetheart, in some Regency costume drama? This is a government department, not a fucking Jane Austen novel. Allow me to pop a jaunty little bonnet on your purview and ram it up the shitter with a lubricated horse cock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm, your swearing doesn't impress me. My husband works for Tower Hamlets and believe me, those kids make you sound like Angela Lansbury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Simon, lads' chat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's married? The poor bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...okay, Judy's lubricated horse cock aside for one moment.... (Judy walks out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying that I'm now not allowed to make any media appearances?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not until we can trust you to keep to the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I was going to keep to the line: "I don't actually think war is unforeseeable."

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: Malcolm's looking out of the office, monitoring Judy's movements. She's flashed up on his radar. He's tracking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it then? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it...I don't know? Foreseeable? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not foreseeable. That's fucking declaring war. Do you want to fucking declare war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a cabinet minister. I didn't get here by screwing up every media appearance I ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write this down. It's neither forseeable nor undorseeable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. So not inevitable, but not...evitable. Malcolm leaves the office. Toby is still hovering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back to Simon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you need to work on this fucking line. (to Judy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That includes you, Jane Fucking Austen with the strap-on. Oh, and put the sniff out there that the next time the BBC ambushes a Minister with a war question we'll drop a bomb on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that. That's political, that's not in my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Purview, Marie Antoinette? Weel listen, darling, why don't you fucking scuttle off back to fucking Cranford and play around with your tea and cake and horse cocks. Let them eat cock! (TO TOBY) You, Ron Weasley -- you do it. Malcolm heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy and Michael in Michael's office. Suzy's getting documents together for the big meeting. Michael's at his computer, on the phone. Classical music still on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needn't worry about the Canadians. They're just happy to be there. (Pause) Yes, well, they always look surprised when they're invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, shall I just give Toby a quick call about the Simon Foster thing? Suzy dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby checks the phone. Sees it's Suzy -- Christ, not her again, I'm a bit busy here. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya. You do know this is the third time you've rung? Are you on a new tariff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? How's it going? You found the bogs yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All a bit manic. It was never like this at Agriculture. People tend not to swear so much about wheat. Apart from farmers. They swear about everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael, re. the music)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you turn that down a bit? (to Toby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've got a leg up for you. I think we could get Simon into the big meeting with Karen Clark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right - Karen Clark from...is that the woman who went round Britain in a coracle for leukemia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen Clark, US Assistant Secretary of State?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right. Shit. Karen Clark. Wow. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Michael wants to say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meat! Simon's only going to be meat in the room. Don't get his hopes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so you know -- Simon, between us, he's just going to be meat in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy, nearby, hears this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving him away) Yeah. The Americans don't feel they're getting a real meeting unless there's thirty of you on each side. So Simon is...you know those polystyrene peanut things they use to pack electrical goods? Sort of one of those. But you might not want to tell him that. I ought to go. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy's hovering nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise. Affirmative on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy is hovering as Toby finishes his call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, quick tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts walking away. Toby follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I do just need to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there...that's Mike's patch. Leave Mike to it. He knows what he's doing. Don't you Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. (as they walk on) He's an idiot. He organised 3,000 tents and sanitation packs for Rwanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...is that not...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They needed them in Luanda. Angola. It's been in the news. (checks phone) And that's the end of the tour. I've got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I understand your hostility to new wood coming in..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot of really important people you need to know about, but I haven't got time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's gone. Toby heads over to Simon's office. The door's open. He pops his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby, hi. Sorry about earlier -- Malcolm. He's a bit of an...alpha male, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've managed to get you into the big meeting at the Foreign Office this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Karen Clark meeting? Shit, really? Sure. How did you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it through sheer bloody hard work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy walks past. Simon calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Judy. She comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tobes here has got me into the big Karen Clark meeting. Judy looks at Toby. She heard the `meat' conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Yeah, the Big Meet. How are you spelling that, by the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two `e's.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FOREIGN OFFICE. DAY
dialogues.text: Simon, Toby and Judy drive along Whitehall in their car. An awkward silence. Judy looks at Toby. She knows Simon's just off to be meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Judy's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just, maybe, might be best not to get too excited. It might be that their guys muscle in and have the lion's share of the talk time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It might be like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can work a room, okay? I'm not a room virgin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, Toby and Judy are going through security. Suzy and Michael come to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael.

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: A very young man approaches Michael. Looks like he is 19. He is CHAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Michael? I'm Chad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like a dual horse-shoe formation for the meeting set-up - an enclave for Ms Clark, an enclave for the Pentagon delegation. First names acceptable to all parties and politely we request the presence of both carbonated and non- carbonated waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks purposefully off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. Who was that, Young Lankenstein?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh he'll be running something relatively major. They're all kids in Washington. It's like Bugsy Malone, but with real guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad's dual horse-shoe is packed with people. The room's pretty much full. KAREN CLARK from the State Department is surrounded by ten or so aides and functionaries, security people and assistants. (Including Chad and LIZA one of Karen's senior aides.) Then there is Bob Adriano's gang of advisors, smaller but sitting separately. Next to them is a Pentagon delegation, including uniformed members of all three services. Lots of hubbub. SUZY leads SIMON, TOBY and JUDY in, and shows them to their seats.

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: They're as far away from the US delegation as it's possible to be, and Simon's seat is actually behind a pillar. Suzy goes off to join Michael and the Foreign Office delegation near the front. Suzy looks over to Toby, uses her hands to make mock binoculars, as if to say, 'you're very far away, look how close and therefore important I am'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-one will hear me if I say anything. How's your view? Can we swap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and Toby swap seats, but Simon can still barely see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Judy) Can I swap with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the meeting's starting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, quickly then, swap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and Judy swap seats. The meeting is now underway. We're with Karen Clark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all agree this is a very tough time, but I don't want a consensus to form around the premise that conflict is necessarily the primary option at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with Simon, Judy and Toby. Simon still straining to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are people thinking that? That's -- a bit hardcore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cranes again to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is worse. Swap back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and Judy swap seats again. Back with Karen. She's holding up a paper in a red folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This paper, authored by one of my aides, Liza Weld. You don't mind me fore- grounding this do you Liza? Liza reacts. Her paper? In a big meeting. Is this good or bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illuminates the logistical factors we face. She highlights a number of reasons why, in practical terms, we can't envision a theatre deployment for twelve months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although not everyone might agree with the assumptions made in that paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really - such as what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The committee feels a much quicker deployment is possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which committee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been discussed in a number of committees. If I said one committee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that was a slip of the tongue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you accidentally alluded to some secret committee? A war committee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can interject here, I'm aware we're pushed for time. I'd like to move us on agenda-wise. Our next item is international relief co-ordination. Karen is conferring with Liza, Adriano with his guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard of this committee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this Liza Weld paper?

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: Simon is watching, feeling the meeting is passing him by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Judy and Toby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I say something? She invited me, I should say something. If you don't say something in the first 10 minutes, you can end up not saying anything at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know whether you should say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying something ... I think I'm going to try saying something. Simon goes to put his hand up, Toby maybe puts a calming hand on his hand. They look at one another. Has Toby crossed a line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look - I just think it's worth noting that Ministers in The UK Government, (Liza whispers - Simon's over there)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: such as our colleague here ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she talking about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon Foster ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's talking about me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has made it clear that for them currently war is unforeseeable. Isn't that right Simon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes, I mean, that's what I said. And I stick to what I said. SIMON sits down. Them stands back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that doesn't mean that what I said won't ever change. It's not imutable. Or mutable. It's an ongoing ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if there aren't some area of mutual agreement we can't rattle through here and see how much time we have at the end for this discussion? He's ended the debate. Suzy comes round the back of the meeting all smiles and hands Judy a note with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. She opens the note it reads, `Simon is acting like a massive tit. Stop him.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all fine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all fine. Thanks for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Toby whispers something in Simon's ear. Simon doesn't look pleased. Karen is still talking to the meeting. Simon shuts up. He'll have this out later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big meeting is breaking up. Simon is annoyed, leading Judy and Toby out of the room and into any private space he can find - they back into a huge huge ballroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here - we need to talk (they go into the massive room, look around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean stop being a `tit'? In what way was I being a tit? Why am I even over here if I'm not meant to say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just meat in the room, Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Meat in the room'? Oh for fuck's sake Judy. I took an hour out to come over here and be room meat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know you're a prime cut, you're not - offal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, I'm not liver. What was I, tit meat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're with Karen Clark's delegation who have just walked downstairs from the meeting room into a ground floor lobby area. KAREN is talking to LIZA, her right-hand woman. TOBY, SIMON and JUDY are above them standing round a circular viewing area that looks down on the lobby. The UK and US delegations are aware of each other, throwing furtive glances each other's way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whichever committee they don't want me to be a member of, I want to be a member of that. It's a confused Groucho Marx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad arrives. Karen talks to someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Liza. Your paper got a major citation. You must be psyched Karen brought it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She...that was her call. I didn't know it had been that widely read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could not write anything that clashes more violently with the current climate than you the one you wrote if you were trying, and it almost seems like you were trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't trying, believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are like the woman from The Omen, you've given birth to a demon and it's going to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably identify with the kid from The Omen right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, you're an only child, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring this up whenever you run out of arguments. I don't see how my parents' limited reproductive abilities reflects badly on me. I'm the sperm that made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza walks off, over to Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun with your career kryptonite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re : Karen talking conspiratorially to Liza downstairs) What's that all about? It looks important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen is back, huddled up with Liza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My teeth hurt. I think the veneers are chipped. Do they look chipped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza stares into Karen's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think that one, that one's always been there, right? I'm not sure. Have you got any painkillers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't look at my teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to earwig) Sshhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up at the Brits, off Simon's smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to risk a dentist here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The US delegation are heading off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Liza!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh ... Hi ... hi? She knows him but can't immediately place him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby? It's Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Hi. She makes the phone sign. He gives a thumbs up, she thinks he's misread the phone sign and gestures, or email by doing typing in the air. Toby signs back, yeah, call on the phone or email - does the typing back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re the typing gesture)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You look like    you're practicing baby massage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did the Kennedy scholarship at my college. I had a small thing for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure she remembered me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that is one of the side effects of Rohypnol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linton has set up a secret war committee, I just know it. I mean, Linton is an absolute lunatic, Liza. He is dangerous. The voices in his head are now singing barbershop together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversation is continuing between Simon Judy and Toby as they exit the FO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jesus. I really really hope there's not a war. It's going to be a nightmare. It's bad enough having to cope with the fucking Olympics. They appear outside. There's a press pack of 10 or so reporters and photographers there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minister!/Simon!/Mr Foster! Simon is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Who let the dogs out? We don't need this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er, you wanted a chance to row back on the war. Do you want to nail the line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. No. I'll freestyle it. The press are calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is war unforeseeable Minister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, (grappling now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...loads of things that are actually very likely are also unforeseeable. Y'know, For the plane in the fog the mountain is unforeseeable, but then it, is suddenly very real and inevitable. Toby and Judy look at one another. This isn't good.

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: The press pack are looking for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, are you saying that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm saying is that to - walk the road of peace, sometimes you need to be ready to climb the mountain of conflict. Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press are writing furiously, making calls already. Simon tries to look confident. He and the team get into their car. 28   INT. CAR DRIVING THRU WESTMINSTER. DAY. (CHANGE SCENE ORDER - GOES AFTER SC. 29G)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby Simon and Judy on the back seat as they drive back to the Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Fuck Fuck Fuck Fuck Fuck. (to Judy) Why didn't we nail the line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did try to warn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did try to warn me but you didn't actually stop me, did you?. That's like shouting 'Train!' as I get hit by a train. You should go (stupid voice) 'Look! Train! There's a Fucking Train!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDY'S and SIMON'S phones start ringing. They each check the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. It's Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Malcolm for me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he do that? (he answers, tentatively) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm has two phones on the go. He's watching the SKY NEWS coverage of Simon's mini-press coverage. It has a `Government ready to Climb the Mountain of Conflict' banner running across the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone, over TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon.   I don't like finding out about people I work with via the news, unless they've died. Get over here now so we can address at least one of those issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy, Simon and Toby are walking towards Malcolm's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is. On the war. With your profile.. (uncertain, but fuck it, he is a senior policy aide to a cabinet minister)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Maybe we should - get it out there? That the war is a resigning issue for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't say it's a resigning issue. Because you then have to resign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are having a really great first day you know that? They walk in, Malcolm's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are supposed to be a Cabinet Minster. You are supposed to be officer class. Don't do this. Don't make waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do without the ritual humiliation, Malcolm. You know I'm against talking up the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're against talking up the war? Is that why you said, "Climb the mountain of conflict"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what you sounded like? You sounded like a fucking Nazi Julie Andrews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying. I might be forced to the verge of making a stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (different tack needed) (at Toby and Judy) Right, you two, The White Stripes, outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon makes to leave with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only two people in the White Stripes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and Judy leave and wait outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I admire you, I really do. Making a stand. So, I take it I can tell the PM you don't want to go to Washington?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To where...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washington. The boss wants you over there on a fact-finder. Problems we might face if it all goes boombastic in the Middle East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were saying, you are on the verge of your stand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look - I don't know what words I used in the heat of the moment, but maybe in a sense I was on the verge. But that's the important thing - I was on the verge. Not in any way decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ on a bendy-bus, Simon, stop being such a faffing fuck-arse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am standing my ground on the verge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you go to America, talk to Karen Clarke at the State Department,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give it a whirl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But keep away from Linton Barwick. He's pushing the war for Caulderwood's lot. I'll deal with him. Dangerous fucker. keeps a live hand-grenade as a paperweight. True story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right.    I won't talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to as few people as possible. That would be best for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza, Karen and Chad arrive in the buzzing State Department offices, knackered but in action mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay - so, priorities are: take a shower, get me on Linton's War Committee, get me a dental appointment. Not necessarily in that order. Karen walks past various desks covered in tons of Post- Its. Stops a STAFFER as he passes. KAREN (cont'd) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Linton been up to while we've been away....have we declared war on California yet? But before the staffer can answer they run right into Linton. Karen stands her ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was London? Good hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great hotel, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good meetings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We had some good discussions. The time at Number Ten could possibly have been better spent but then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen realises that Linton is reading a message on his cell phone and not listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Welcome back. I'll read your words when they come through. Thank you so much

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linton heads off to his office. A beat later so does Karen. Chad goes off a little towards Linton's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Chad coming... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching) He's doing his desperate chorus girl thing, hanging around trying to catch Linton's eye. That's why he's wearing his push-up bra today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he passes) Assistant Secretary of State -- hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Exactly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linton ignores him as he goes to join Bob Adriano waiting for him in his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So listen, Liza, I need you to find out the names of the ten dullest committees currently operating on the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dullest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Linton is not going to call it the big horrible scarey war committee...they'll have buried the war committee under the most boring name they can think of. 'Diverse Strategy Committee'- not that, I'm on that. But it'll be a committee that sounds so tedious you want to self-harm. They glance over into Linton's area. He is glancing into theirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get me General Miller at the Pentagon? (as she leaves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My teeth hurt like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sick of hearing about the teeth... Liza goes to her desk, picks up her landline. LIZA (cont'd) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm calling from Karen Clark's office about a paper written by a staffer here. We need to know if 'Post War Planning: Parameters, Implication's and Possibilities' has reached Assistant Secretary of State Linton Barwick yet? (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...by Liza Weld. (listens, shit!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Pwip Pip'? It's already been given an acronym? (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I don't want to fast-track it. Would it possible to slow-track it? Well can we create one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking over at Karen. Now alone, who is still stealing glances over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not understand why anyone would choose to work in a glass office. In my opinion glass offices are for perverts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could request the glass be frosted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if Bob Adriano brought it up) Frosting is for cakes, Bob. Now. What happened in London?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Generally positive. Two glitches. Karen flagged a report by one of her staffers - Liza. She's obviously trying to use it as some kind of roadblock. It's called Pwip Pip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pip what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pwip Pip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that a report on - birdcalls? What does that stand for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't recall. It's factish. Intel - case for and against intervention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got all the facts we need on this. In the land of truth, my friend, the man with one fact is king. You said there was another thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meeting with the Foreign Office the Committee was accidentally briefly alluded to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting his hand over his mouth so he can't be lip- read) Which committee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doing the same) The war committee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen must not find out about that. She is an excitable yapping she-dog. Okay get the minutes of the meeting, we need to correct the record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we can. They're an aide memoir for us. So they should not be a reductive record of what happened to be said, but a more full record of what was intended to be said. I think that's the more accurate version, right? LATER. Bob Adriano is going through the minutes with Linton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this section. Cut that. I don't think this is really what France are saying. Let's change that. And these. And let's reverse this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's something Karen said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not right. Change it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say everyone agreed with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy's in her office on the phone, laughing. Simon's eyeing her suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she so fucking happy about? Is she laughing at me? Judy closes the blinds on her side of the office. SIMON (CONT'D) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's she got control of the blinds? I'm a government minister. I should have blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking) You want me to order some blinds? Or I could get some heavy curtains with swags and a pelmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go somewhere else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk to Box Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So listen. My team for the US. Team Simon. I'm thinking of taking you and leaving Judy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could work with that, definitely. Plus she can be a bit... you know? "Everything's a bit shit isn't it?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "So you're the President? And I'm supposed to be impressed by that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. "My husband works in Tower Hamlets."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "That's much harder than being President". Okay. It's settled. Fuck it. She's staying behind. Go and tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 Karen, Liza and Linton are among those seated round the table. Various staffers are standing, including Chad. And Bob Adriano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which brings us on to Any Other Business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe I've flagged everything I needed to discuss. As I usually do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting her hand over her mouth, mocking Linton's gesture from earlier) Or everything you're prepared to discuss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that, Karen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you've started up a new committee, what's it called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was mentioned in our London meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have misheard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I misheard the word committee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was another word. Like Khomeini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sitting on a new Khomeini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly. There are a lot of words, Karen. Kansas City. Kitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Itty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Itty is not a word, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, James

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Why don't you just recap for me all the committees that you're currently sitting on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sorry, Karen, you appear to be bleeding from your mouth. She is. But she doesn't want to leave the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh don't try to change the subject Linton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looking at Karen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. Holy Mother of.... Everyone is just looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to be rude Karen but that is a tad... repulsive. I can't concentrate on what you're saying. You have blood coming out of your teeth and that's not right. Karen gets up to go. It's awkward, she's boxed in and has to clamber over the others to get to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Liza come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside, to Liza)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Buffy - you belong to the vampire queen now. Liza follows Karen out. Chad takes Liza's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like to see a woman bleeding from the mouth. It makes me think of Country and Western music. Which I really can't abide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (what?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Ha ha! Exactly. Linton sees his chance to take advantage of Karen being out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually while we're on Any Other Business I do have a few points I'd like to resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head into the bathroom. Liza is pulling handfuls of tissue. Handing them to Karen who is dabbing her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are at you at with the committees?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it down to two. The Aims and Policy Alignment Committee. Here - put some down your front - you don't want it to go down your... And the Future Planning Committee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not the first one. I set that one up. Does that really sound dull to you? I thought that was a good name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, no, it is a good name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, find out if it is definitely the Future Planning Committee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. Right, listen, I might go and do that. You're not going to shout at me if I go and do that are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a fucking monster Liza, okay? Will you stop implying I'm some kind of monster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza heads out of the toilets to see Bob Adriano ahead, quite a long way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob! Bob Adriano stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza. Liza sprints and catches up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So listen, Bob, there's something I really want to tell you. We're having a hunk of the month competition, and I just didn't want you to be feel...objectified in any way....and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopes it might be a come- on?) Oh really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen knows about the Future Planning Committee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Adriano looks shocked, tries to cover it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza smiles. Runs back into the toilets and gives a thumbs up to Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and Toby walking past the queues at US immigration, they are being ushered through a separate channel by airport workers and diplomatic staff. As they're escorted Simon and Toby catch each other's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be callow Toby. We're on official business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Homeland Security official ushers them through. SIMON (CONT'D) (cont'd) This is a little bit fucking cool.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. WASHINGTON AIRPORT
dialogues.text: But then they reach the end of security and find themselves dumped into the same arrivals area as everyone else. They walk through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be a car won't there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God yeah, of course.

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: They walk slowly looking at the various cabbies and chauffeurs holding signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you book a car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? No. I mean, Judy will have got someone to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He calls on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Judy? Yeah sorry if you're in bed, but we're here and... (looks through papers) Just can't see the car? Wondered what the car situation was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercut with Judy in bed at her flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What car situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airport car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not my job Toby. That's Robbie's job to book it, your job to check it and confirm it. Alright? Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The call is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Simon) Yeah. She's really embarrassed. Sounds like a snarl up her end. I'll see what we can do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's looking panicked - then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a guy with a sign that says `England Government - Simon Forester'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Simon Forester?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the taxi guy) Hi we're the Simon Foster party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver takes their bags and they follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and Toby are heading into Washington. Their car is accompanied by two police motorcycles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re : the limo) I almost feel like there should be hookers. Do you know what I mean? Really, here, we should have hookers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thumbs up, on his mobile) Hey Gav, I'm in a fucking motorcade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified of things getting out of hand) What? Oh no. God no. No no no no no. I was just - I was just joking. I don't want hookers. I hate hookers. I mean not in an aggressive way. I'm just not interested. (uncomfy beat, then) But thanks. Thanks very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out of the limo, take in the hotel facade. Not bad. Pretty fucking good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in. Oh. Right. Not so impressive then. Not crappy. Just very bland and ordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a hangar for businessmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and Toby enter with the porter. He hangs around for a tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby, have you....?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seaching his pockets) I haven't been to an ATM yet...I've only got English....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON finds two crumbled up one dollar bills and presses them into the porter's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's supposed to be a dollar a bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porter leaves. TOBY goes to window, opens curtain. The Capitol it just visisble through a building site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically, you've got a Capitol Hill view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smart private cocktail party in a fancy Georgetown house. Karen and General Miller spot each other. They each take a glass of champagne from a waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Karen. You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you say that to all the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I do. And some of the guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you shouldn't run for Senate. Too many skeletons in your enormous closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, don't believe the hype. I'm just thinking about doing ... something. I'm more than just a soldier, Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, you're passionate about education and housing and what's the other thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lingerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And bestiality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd forgotten about that. Are you still allergic to that dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. I wake up and my eyes are closed and my head is swollen and I look like a giant ball sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, they do have memdication for that.....but a beautiful ball sack, though. And how's the pentagon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kicked up a level. Talking invasion real soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there somewhere we can talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I don't live in this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Miller and Karen are in Caulderwood's kids' play room. Toys are piled up everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if someone comes in now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't think of an excuse that would work can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just be careful. Don't mess stuff up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit down on the child's bed. Miller grabs a crayon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay so that's total minimum European Theatre requirement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows her a figure on a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he scribbles) This is Far East, Korea, Japan etc.

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: He scribbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Add those. Plus contingency already deployed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er - you've lost me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller looks around, grabs a child's laptop. Opens it, it says `howday' in an electronic voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your military hardware is impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore it isn't. Okay so this is total current deployment. (he types) Europe, Asia. (He types) And the contingency already deployed. (He types) So the current number of combat troops available for an invasion according to these figures would be ... (he presses the `equals' button)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, twelve. Twelve soldiers. Twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shitting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm shitting you, but 12 thousand isn't enough. Twelve thousand's about how many are going to die. And you really need a few guys alive at the end of a war or it looks like you've lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Tomorrow I've got to meet these Brits. Simon Foster. He's the guy that said war was unforseeable, and I think he could very useful on the committee because he could internationalise the dissent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to use him as a little meat puppet. INT. WASHINGTON HOTEL - TOBY'S ROOM. 47 Simon knocks on the door. Toby opens, he's in his boxer shorts and shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tobes. Hi. So! What's the plan? What swanky reception are we going to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panic in his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the plan? For tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's what I'm asking you Toby, my chief aide, my political advisor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I thought tonight we'd be tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching breaking point with Toby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I am tired but I'm also a career politician Toby, in the political powerhouse of the world for forty-eight hours. So I thought it might be nice to, you know, go out rather than sit in my room trying to spank one out watching a shark documentary, because I'm scared if I watch a porno it'll end up in the Register of Members Interests. So what have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay ... What have I got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bullshit me Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay - so far, we have ... one flyer under the door for happy hour in the bar - which might be interesting? And I have the number of a guy I was with at Uni who I believe now works for CNN out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: INT. GEORGETOWN PARTY. EVE.
dialogues.text: Karen on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waving at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself more visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm practically on top of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stop talking on your phone now. Look, I have to leave. Phone Simon Foster's guy. Tell them to come to the war committee. I'll give them some face time around ten o'clock. It'll be coffee and Danish...tea..they're going to want tea. Tea and sympathy. Tea and a handjob, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone, deep breath) Hey Toby! It's Liza Weld. Do you remember? What you guys doing tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and Simon are lying on separate beds in their underpants watching a shark documentary. Toby is the on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is still a great deal that is unknown about great white shark mating behaviour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it is unbelievably hectic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can definitely spot the female ones can't you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby's ending his call with Liza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attending the war committee. That's big. I mean, I have been on a committee before. "Challenges for the cheese market" - that was a big one... but...yes, sure I'd love a drink. Forty minutes? Great. (he does that mobile thing where people sign off by repeatedly saying `bye' with increasing speed but diminishing volume) Bye bye bye-bye-bye-bye-bye bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Very excited. Starts getting ready to see Liza. Checks his hair in the mirror. Not quite right. He opens a pot of hair gel, takes a scoop and rubs it in his hands, ready to put it in his hair. His phone goes again. Doesn't know what to do. Doesn't want to pick up the phone with gelly hands. No time to wash it off. Grabs a towel and picks up the phone holding the towel. He struggles to press the answer button. Puts the towel- covered phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Hi? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hear through the towel. Tries to adjust it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matty, hi, How's CNN? yes -- sorry? Do I sound muffled? Can't mate. Yeah, Liza Weld's's got us on to Linton's Future Planning Committee in the morning. The war committee, to you and me. So I'm prepping...what? Yes, Future Planning Committee is the war committee. You don't know that? I thought you worked for CNN? Or is that Cartoon Network News?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon has just answered the door to MALCOLM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in....I just wasn't expecting you to be here. Physically here. Obviously, you're always in my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, I'm there, I'm fucking everywhere. I am the egg-man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you come to insult me in a different time zone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby still on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, off out now for a drink with her...yeah, yeah, ha-di-ha, but nothing's going to happen there. Little Toby's staying in his hammock tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby checks himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby comes out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, I've managed to get us on the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm is suddenly in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heart attack) Fuck! Malcolm! Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're meant to shit yourself in there. Not out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (to Simon) I've got us on to Linton's Future Planning Committee in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the war committee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? The actual....war committee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Liza says that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's going to be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen Clark, Liza, me and Simon. (off Simon's look) Simon and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else is going -- Jimmy Osmond? Gwyneth Paltrow? You've been invited to a diversion. The real committee, the real thing, that's happening at The White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby picks his jacket up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, I'll text you the details because I'm going to go out.for A quick drink with some State Department bods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mention this to the press, ok? Don't mention it to anyone. Because if the press get a whiff there's a war committee, even a cardboard one, every fucker in this town is going to turn up and try and get on it. So no matter what gay bar you end up, keep it schtumm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm flicks the TV over to a news channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was watching that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to have a word with you. You might want to slip into your negligee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and Liza sit in a booth. They are by far the most formally dressed people in the club. A band are playing angry rock with a vaguely political message. A small knot of people are rocking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re : the mosh pit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see those guys? The mosh pit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I don't think I've ever seen a more civilised 'mosh pit' it's more of a mosh caucus actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: House staffers, Senators' interns, most of them are half-man half-PDF file. Tonight they rage hard. Tomorrow they go back to the hill and argue noise reduction legislation. They're chuckling, having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, looks at her.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she's been mulling on something else entirely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Pwip Pip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry? Pip Pip? Is this... a person or a cell phone tarrif or..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my paper. On the war. Pros and Cons of the war. But I came up with too many cons. The pro-war guys have started calling me `Connie'. So, yes I'm fucking worried. My career's on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah- I noticed you're worried, cos I saw you looking worried. I'm perceptive like that. But... (can't think of anything else)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, this place blows. I'm going. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm incredibly tired. It feels like my brain's eight hours behind but my liver's 12 hours ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to come back to my place for a quick catch up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an alluring offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, due to technological developments I no longer need sleep, but am physically rejuvenated by alcohol!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He guzzles from his beer bottle as they leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and Liza are on the bed together, kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I just say, you know, that what happens in Washington stays in Washington?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I live in Washington. So that doesn't really work for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm is     still in Simon's room. He's texting. Simon sneaks the     remote and flips from the news back to the shark doc.     Malcolm, without looking up, picks up the remote and     flicks back to the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are under enormous pressure Simon. Karen will want you to say, `war is unforeseeable'. Linton will want you to talk up `climbing the mountain of conflict'. You say nothing, okay? You can't swing both ways, you're not David fucking Bowie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Can I go to bed now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're going to run that through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I being tortured?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby wakes up. His mouth is parched. He feels terrible. He rolls over. Liza is gone. He can't remember where he is or what's going on. Then with a flash as he looks at the clock - 9.07 he remembers a lot of things in a rush and springs out like a Ninja and starts pulling his clothes on, while scrabbling for his phone. He heads down stairs & out of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello I need a number for a taxi in Washington DC. Straight through please. He's on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. I need a cab, right now. From? From where? From from (sees the house number )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 40, 46, that's the number, and it's a street. It's a nice street with houses and cars and a - sidewalk and it's got leaves and - hold on I'm walking, I'm walking to a sign ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby running. 61   INT. KAREN CLARK'S OFFICE. DAY. Karen, Liza and Simon are making small talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcel's is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go to La Taverna, the Greek place. It's fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They set fire to the cheese. It's a lot of fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds a lot of fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the aerospace museum, the National Gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they set fire to the paintings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polite laughter. Toby comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi I'm sorry I'm so late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re Toby) And this is your guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He's, you know, among my guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby shoots Simon a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Toby) I'm Karen. And I believe you already know Liza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she can't know?) Yes. From college, in England.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulled an all-nighter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby looks to Liza for guidance. She's not giving any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I, uh, got led astray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh who by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
