dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Advances on Michael, becomes aware of the music. Jamie points to the CD player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay for a start turn that fucking row off. It's just fucking vowels. Listen to it. Just subsidised fucking foreign vowels. You only listen to that shit because it's bad form to actually wear a big hat that says "I went to private school".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael doesn't turn it off, so Jamie does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did you leak it to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just sent it. I thought it was important so I sent it through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers then, )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. See this fax machine?(kick) That's your career. I'm pretty sure it's fucked. Let me just check (kick). Yeah, it is. Plus, breach of Official Secrets, so that's fucking swannee. Maybe you can get a part time job in West End as a gentleman's fluffer. Or whatever the fuck they call it these days. Jamie is heading off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know -- better to go out with a bang...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. I will not allow this to be a bang. This will be a whimper, a tiny pathetic whimper like a puppy being fucked by a big metal puppy-fucking machine. And they do exist, `cos my gran's got one. Jamie leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm and Linton enter. We see Simon's mints lying on the big stone in the middle of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're down to the wire here, Mr Miracle Worker, what have you got for me? What intel have you rustled us up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly? I haven't got it. We need more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't got it? Can you delay the vote to give you time to get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I've had the vote brought forward. Simon comes in to retrieve his mints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just getting my mints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am telling you to delay the vote and get me some new intel. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, quick reality check, J Edgar Fucking Hoover. I don't work for you. You don't tell me what to fucking do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well firstly, don't raise your voice. This is a sacred space. You may not believe that, I may not believe that, but by God it's a useful hypocrisy. And secondarily you do work for me. Your prime minister instructed you to work for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm glances at Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your Polos and fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon stays where he is. Linton starts laughing. Toby enters, watches in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great Malcolm Tucker. One of your guys has leaked a paper, you can't do anything. We tell you to get intel, you can't do anything. I need the vote put back - you can't do anything. You, sir, are a useless piece of `S' star star `T'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, to Toby) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've just heard -- the wall's starting to collapse. A brick has fallen. That's the news I'm getting. More to follow. Both news and bricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linton laughs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you deal with that Tucker? A wall is falling down, that's more your level. I can see you with your shirt off and a wheelbarrow whistling a happy song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linton walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been working for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's complicated, okay? I've been juggling a number of responsibilities. Simon stares at Malcolm. He takes a mint and pops it in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well, right, after the vote, I resign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. It's too late now. Resigning. It's not worth it. The horse has bolted. It's out there getting shot now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you later, Malcolm. Simon exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Toby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you repeat this to anyone I will pull your leg off, break it in two and stab you to death with your broken shin bone. Now go away. Toby leaves. Malcolm sits down, head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The delegates are still mingling. Toby is there now. Toby's phone goes. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy, how's it going? Has Jamie been round? Right... Liza comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is you, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me, yes. And that's you. I thought we had this worked out. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Suze I've got an incoming call, I'll ring back for a further bollocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something big lined up and you better not have fucked it up for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liza leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello? Oh hi, Paul. How's it going? No, yes, I know the wall is collapsing. I'm as frustrated as you are mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vice President starts to walk by. Toby sees him, wants to shake his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, could I call you back Paul? It's just the Vice President's ... I couldn't? No, okay, let's keep talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vice President has gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108 Michael and Suzy in Michael's office, classical music in the background. Michael's clearing his desk, putting stuff in boxes. Jamie bursts in on Michael and Suzy, his phone still on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Frank and Nancy Sinatra. I've got good news. You're not fired. That's great news, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds ominous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fucking delighted. (cancels phone) We want to put Liza Weld's Pwip Pip out there, properly. In the public domain. We just have to refine it a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Refine it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take out the cons, change the name of the main informant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a complete fabrication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Changing his name doesn't make a difference. The main source in there he's not really called Ice Man, is he? "Mr and Mrs Man, you've got a son, Ice." So we change it, to another name. Who's the fuck with the fiddle? The Fiddlefuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Debussy, if that's what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we'll call him Debussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then you'll make a couple of other changes. It'll mean your fingerprints are on it, Mikey, but it's the only way to save your job, you leaky fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is now scared of what he's being asked to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me, Jamie, alright? It wasn't me. Don't make me do this. Someone else must have come in and used the fax machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh, that thing about your fax? Don't worry about that. I made that up. The paper was sent by e-mail. It;s just, the fax machine was there and it;s easier to kick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks at Suzy. She doesn't know what to say or do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Michael) Come on Deuce Bigalow. You're coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags Michael out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the closed door of the Meditation Room. Malcolm suddenly bursts out, re-energised, ready for action. He's in the middle of a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, BBC newsdesk please. Malcolm Tucker. (BEAT) Ben? Hi, how you doing? Yeah, well, I'm hearing you're preparing a story that we might not like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the doors he pushes open has a coffee machine in it. Toby is there getting a coffee. Malcolm gestures to him to come along. Toby joins Malc in his jog through the corridors, spilling his coffee on his hands as he goes and scalding himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to say please, this garden wall story, please don't run with it. (beat, winks at Toby - you getting this?) Simon Foster's constituency-office wall? You've got that haven't you? I haven't let the cat out of the bag? Shit. Look, my reputation will be in tatters if you run with... (to Toby) And he's gone. Boo hoo. I've got a hard on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we stop running because my hands are really rather badly burned now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it was you who leaked Linton's War Committee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? Right. (tries it out for size) It wasn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me it wasn't you? Is that your proposition? Is that want you want to say if I ask them to fly you to Diego Garcia and slip a hood over your head and carry out a cavity search?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering) I don't actually recall. It was a busy time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more like it. So...you are now on probation. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am giving you a probationary period, which will last from today...until the end of recorded time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my guy now. I own you now. You're my Kunte Kinte. Go and get your laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby goes. Malcolm pushes open another door. Sir Jonathan Tutt is in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, ambassador -- with your big baldy head you are spoiling us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, I've been looking for you. I needed to tell you that by a huge personal effort -- huge --I have managed to bring the vote forward by an hour and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I need it delayed now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny. That is funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By an hour, at least. Although I guess two and a half hours now, as you've brought it forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm sorry I'm very sorry but I won't humiliate myself again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do what I say or you can go and see if Belize are looking for a new ambassador but with a broken nose, one bollock, and a half-chewed cock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Jonathan walks in. A lot of faces are turned towards him, expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. What can I say? ......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie has taken Michael into a tiny windowless office. Michael's hunched at his laptop, looking at the Pwip-Pip document on his computer. Jamie stands right over him, ominously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael re: the office)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nice isn't it? Cosy. Away from prying eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's this, your political wet-room? Jamie's phone goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby is standing in front of Malcolm, holding his laptop up for Malcolm to look at and a physical copy of the red Pwip-Pip folder. He's also got the Pwip-Pip file on screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it up, have you got it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah it's all fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, go to page nine, highlight that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to page nine. Michael does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highlight from that page to the end of the document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mean select?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know I don't use these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Select page nine to the end of the document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caveats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael does it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it highlighted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean selected, yeah it's selected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, right, standby ... delete!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) Delete!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subdued) You can't just delete the arguments against the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stops what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Toby) Messenger! Get Messenger up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby sticks Pwip-Pip in his mouth so he's got a hand free to initiate MSN messenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hang on Malc. Michael's stopped moving. I think he's crashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm types something on the laptop while Toby holds it up for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you tried hitting him? Give him a thump, that usually works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, I think I might be able to use manual over-ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie picks up Michael's hand and pulls out his index finger and places it on the delete key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. It's working again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Now attach that to email.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attach that to an email.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Toby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, let's find a printer. The Japanese, they'll have one. They've got everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm approaches Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a blue folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking know. Do I look like I've ever set foot in a stationary cupboard? I do my shagging in five star hotels. Now go and find me a blue fucking folder. Pronto. Toby runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm walks in. He holds up his blue folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intelligence your guys couldn't find? I think you owe me a massive, grovelling apology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you did your job? Eventually? Congratulations. Maybe they'll give you a knighthood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been   a pleasure working with you. You know,   I've met some psychos in my time, but   none as fucking BORING as you. Oh sorry,   that's right. You disapprove of swearing.   A boring F star star CUNT! Malc hands over the folder and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linton, with Adriano now back beside him AND LIZA, is waiting for hush from the assembled US delegation, including Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard Liza. By the way, congratulations on Pwip Pip. Excellent work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I haven't read it personally. No time. But it certainly raised your profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That old thing? That was like a thousand years ago. More maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific. (to the delegation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'll keep this brief and   to the point. We go in, we make our   case using the new British intelligence   from their source `Debussy', we win the   argument, we get the hell out. The delegation starts filing out.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UN CORRIDOR- DAY
dialogues.text: The Brit delegation are gathered round a screen in a corridor showing the main debating chamber. The mood is sombre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resolution 5977 is passed. Judy looks at Malcolm. Malcolm looks straight ahead at the screen, nods, impassive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. That's that then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "That's that then"? That's your quote for the ages is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'And I remember the moment war was declared. I turned to the Minister and he said "That's that, then. Anyone want a mint?".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss off, Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mood is quietly buzzy. Job well done. Liza is there too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it Bob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir! There were moments when it was a little hairy ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No there weren't, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands with various colleagues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TV shows BBC News 24's report on the vote. Jamie is stroking Michael's hair in a sweet and therefore very very scary way. Michael's staring ahead pretending it isn't happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly) Well done Michael. You did a good job. You did a really, really good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 119 Karen enters. Chad is there too with General Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I emailed my resignation ten minutes ago. (to Miller) Yours should come right after the President's announcement, to have the biggest media impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking Karen. This has been the hardest fucking decision of my political life. I'm not resigning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck George. Seriously? You said that the war was intolerable and we'd go together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is - it is intolerable. I still agree with myself about that. But I've got to tolerate it. My loyalty is with the kids. At the end of the day I'm a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the uniform, Karen. I'm not a pastry chef. I have military commendations on my chest, not a little fucking label saying My Name Is George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a politician. You live on canapes and white wine and you have three anecdotes you wheel out at every party and you scour the national papers for mentions of your name. You're a fucking politician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you shot a guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, if I haven't shot a guy in 15 years then I'm not a soldier? City hall don't insist I bring along a fucking bullet- ridden corpse every five years to renew my soldier licence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this is an unnecessary war. It's a war you don't believe in. Show me some balls, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I've got balls, I don't need to show them to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure, It just so happens they're sitting pretty in a pair of Egyptian cotton Ralph Lauren shorts on a Government salary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk about my fucking balls that way. My balls have been around. My balls have got balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Chad, let's leave the General and his over-stuffed scrotum. We're going to draft our resignation announcements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen turns away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er, I might, stay with the General actually Karen, if that's okay? If he's staying I might stay with him and see what assistance I can furnish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. General Shrek and his faithful talking donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This takes balls Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got balls Sir. Anyone can see you've got big balls. They're two-thirds of a snowman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. This was not the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon's on the phone to the wall man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're right. I am a piss-brain. That's the perfect word, Mr Michaelson. Your mother came up with it? Well congratulate her from me. I am a piss- brain for letting this happen.

dialogues.speaker: CON TINUE D
dialogues.text: Simon sees Malcolm coming along. Starts to head back into the shared office. He rings off, Malcolm catches up with him in the office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, look, mate. Listen to me. You still don't need to resign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm going to resign, Malcolm. In a hour. You can't stop me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss? SIMON                         MALCOLM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?                               Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the BBC News website -- Partial collapse of the wall. Mrs Michaelson's greenhouse has a smashed pane. The BBC had a crew down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, and that's NEWS. Ridiculous, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nor Ridiculous. You're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall. It's just not tolerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a fucking wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. (clicks his fingers at Toby) Give me the paper. (off Simon's look) He's my new boy. I'm just breaking him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Telegraph has a cartoon of you crushed underneath the Great Wall Of China, suggesting you are the only political fuck-up visible from space. Look at this. No one could survive this. The PM is very clear on this - you're sacked, over the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't even - spoken to the Prime Minister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking haven't I've been right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have spoken to the Prime Minister. Whether it has happened or not is irrelevant. It is true. As soon as I heard about the wall, I spoke to him and he decided you had to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well if you try to turn this into some anti-war protest, you can expect your `mountain of conflict' soundbite to be everywhere from ringtones to a fucking dance mix on YouTube. I will marshall all the forces of media darkness to hound you to an assisted suicide. A silence while Simon and Toby realise there is nowhere for him to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Rumpleforeskin's give me your laptop, so -- shall we draft your `Dear Prime Minister, just a quick note to say thanks for sacking me' letter? Simon doesn't know what else to do. Toby goes to get his laptop. Miller is having a cigarette under a no-smoking sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. General? Look I realise this is a slightly strange time to say this, but I just want to say how much I admire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fuck yoursefl, Frodo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Lovely Toby hurries off looking crushed. Miller takes another drag on his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STATE DEPARTMENT. DAY
dialogues.text: 121 Linton is going through a list with Liza. General Miller is sitting in on this meeting, looking slightly like a man who's being shafted up the ass and having to pretend to enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I don't want to be accused of micro managing but I personally do not see that `I heart Huckabees' should be on the list of dvds suitable for forces entertainment. That self-indulgent crap is not suitable entertainment for combat troops. And where's `United 93' on here? That should be playing 24/7. INT. CONSTITUENCY OFFICE. DAY. 122 Simon is back with Roz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, I've got a selection of quotes for you, they're all local firms and none of them is very well respected. (gets another piece of paper out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, this sceptic tank is also rearing it's pooy head again too. Simon looks zonked with boredom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Alan, I have been balled out by Linton for allowing I Heart Huckabees on to the troops DVD roster. You know the phrase, "I'm too old for this shit? Well, I'm too young for this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be out there having a youth. Getting high, making women pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm is walking through the open-plan office with Judy. In the background we see Toby getting the last of his things together. The NEW MINISTER and her ADVISOR arrive. They are almost carbon copies of Simon and Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, here they are. Minister. Elizabeth. Welcome aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Malcolm. Looking forward to it. War seems to be going `great guns' at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, cheeky! Let me take you out for an expensive lunch, roast swan and all the trimmings, and I'll bring you up to speed on the whole Middle East situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you twisting my arm already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, but in a friendly, non-breaky way. Watch your step there. There's still blood on the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Judy) Hi I'm Danny. Dan. I'm Elizabeth's chief advisor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy Molloy. Senior Press -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I got a desk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's that one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points at Toby's desk. The Minister and his advisor start making themselves at home. We stay on Toby now as Malcolm and Judy greet the new guys.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUE D
dialogues.text: Toby grabs the last of his things, glances over at them, and them we follow him as he heads down the front steps.
